title: Reddit migrators of Ruqqus, what made you change ships?

body: Change? I think about 90% of the users continue to use Reddit and Ruqqus is still in the shipyard being built.
body_html: Change? I think about 90% of the users continue to use Reddit and Ruqqus is still in the shipyard being built.

guild.description:
Ask and answer questions.

Rules:

🤔 Posts must be questions. This is a community dedicated to Q&A discussion, so post titles must be in the form of a question.

⁉️ No loaded questions.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

🥾 Breaking these rules will result in posts being kicked and possibly an exile.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

post.title: Reddit migrators of Ruqqus, what made you change ships?

body: It just wasn't fun anymore. Even in the non-political subs there's a 50/50 chance of your post being deleted over some meaningless technicality. There's no joy or fun there... only angst, mental illness and powerless people clicking arrows to make themselves feel a tiny bit less powerless.
body_html: It just wasn't fun anymore. Even in the non-political subs there's a 50/50 chance of your post being deleted over some meaningless technicality. There's no joy or fun there... only angst, mental illness and powerless people clicking arrows to make themselves feel a tiny bit less powerless.

post.title: Reddit migrators of Ruqqus, what made you change ships?

author.bio: No reason for me to be here anymore. If you’re interested in anime art ping me and maybe I’ll respond.
author.bio_html: No reason for me to be here anymore. If you’re interested in anime art ping me and maybe I’ll respond.

body:
I made my account after the seeing the WRD automoderator comment. I didn't really get going until after the "trap" ban from r/animemes. I tried to argue against those who were for censorship and got banned from a couple of subs. 

I still haven't "change ship" per say, as I still use reddit for PCM, goodanimemes and other small subs. I don't actively post or comment anymore though.
body_html:
I made my account after the seeing the WRD automoderator comment. I didn't really get going until after the "trap" ban from r/animemes. I tried to argue against those who were for censorship and got banned from a couple of subs.

I still haven't "change ship" per say, as I still use reddit for PCM, goodanimemes and other small subs. I don't actively post or comment anymore though.

post.title: Reddit migrators of Ruqqus, what made you change ships?

body: Seeing reddit censor whole opinions. I wasn't even an active redditor, but I created an account on Ruqqus then started testing Reddit's censorship. I only used moderate rhetorics but was getting banned even for stuff like "Do your own research on Kyle Rittenhouse, and don't call him either a terrorist or innocent. Until the court ruling he's a *suspect*". This sealed the deal.
body_html: Seeing reddit censor whole opinions. I wasn't even an active redditor, but I created an account on Ruqqus then started testing Reddit's censorship. I only used moderate rhetorics but was getting banned even for stuff like "Do your own research on Kyle Rittenhouse, and don't call him either a terrorist or innocent. Until the court ruling he's a suspect". This sealed the deal.

post.title: Reddit migrators of Ruqqus, what made you change ships?

body: After the 6/29 banwave, I stopped posting and starting unfollowing everything and saying my goodbyes. By the July 4th weekend, I completely stopped participating on Reddit 100%.

post.title: Reddit migrators of Ruqqus, what made you change ships?

body: It's amazing what harmless stuff will trigger the mods there. I was very neutral for a long time on Reddit, but when it stops being fun altogether, and  you notice that you're kind of tiptoeing around asking completely reasonable questions, it's time to go.
body_html: It's amazing what harmless stuff will trigger the mods there. I was very neutral for a long time on Reddit, but when it stops being fun altogether, and you notice that you're kind of tiptoeing around asking completely reasonable questions, it's time to go.

post.title: Reddit migrators of Ruqqus, what made you change ships?

body: Wanted to see something new, other than the generic front page shit that’s always there. Also the subs that I loved the most got shit because it got too popular.

post.title: Reddit migrators of Ruqqus, what made you change ships?

body: I hate the omnipresence of dumb children who can't be taught to shut up for a minute before they have something meaningful to say. There's no fun Reddit lore anymore the same way there was years ago -- stories that everyone knew and the like. It was never perfect but the site is so braindead and Facebook-y now that it makes me feel guilty to have an account.
body_html: I hate the omnipresence of dumb children who can't be taught to shut up for a minute before they have something meaningful to say. There's no fun Reddit lore anymore the same way there was years ago -- stories that everyone knew and the like. It was never perfect but the site is so braindead and Facebook-y now that it makes me feel guilty to have an account.

post.title: Reddit migrators of Ruqqus, what made you change ships?

author.bio: Fantasy lore enthusiast, Human history critic. Your feelings do not matter. Speak your mind.  Counter bad ideas with good ideas. Pro LGB, Pro Guns, Pro Drugs, Pro Human, Anti Race. FUCK THE CCP!
author.bio_html: Fantasy lore enthusiast, Human history critic. Your feelings do not matter. Speak your mind. Counter bad ideas with good ideas. Pro LGB, Pro Guns, Pro Drugs, Pro Human, Anti Race. FUCK THE CCP!

body:
I downloaded all my saved posts (mostly art) saved all the links, Deleted all of them, un-followed every sub i was following. I occasionally lurk in hobby subs still, but only the hobbies that are not also being attacked by the leftist agenda.

I got suspended for critiquing art when asked to and suggesting someone go back to the fundamentals, but because it was a BLM art piece, I got the boot. Did not say anything political. Just that their line work was shoddy and they rushed to the details before the foundation was good.
body_html:
I downloaded all my saved posts (mostly art) saved all the links, Deleted all of them, un-followed every sub i was following. I occasionally lurk in hobby subs still, but only the hobbies that are not also being attacked by the leftist agenda.

I got suspended for critiquing art when asked to and suggesting someone go back to the fundamentals, but because it was a BLM art piece, I got the boot. Did not say anything political. Just that their line work was shoddy and they rushed to the details before the foundation was good.

post.title: Reddit migrators of Ruqqus, what made you change ships?

body: I mean it's still like the 15th most visited website in the world (last time I checked). I kinda hate how the admins run the sites now too, but the sheer amount of people using reddit means significantly more content there.

post.title: Reddit migrators of Ruqqus, what made you change ships?

body: I was on some of the emulation and custom firmware related subs but since posts get buried so quickly on that site it made a lot more sense to post those things on gbatemp. The technical aspects of gaming seem much more suited for forums in general. Reddit is more for opinions and hot takes, in my experience.

The technical aspects of gaming seem much more suited for forums in general. Reddit is more for opinions and hot takes, in my experience.

post.title: Reddit migrators of Ruqqus, what made you change ships?

body: Certain subs that I liked died or starting becoming political hellscapes from the ever growing number of left leaning people, I just wanted to see some actual dank memes, good political humour and dark humour, but everything became so mainstream that all the subs doing these started becoming homogeneous, to the point where nothing had the edge or bite that I liked, it was all a bit too casual I guess you could say. That tends to happen with a lot of things when they go mainstream, they lose character.
body_html: Certain subs that I liked died or starting becoming political hellscapes from the ever growing number of left leaning people, I just wanted to see some actual dank memes, good political humour and dark humour, but everything became so mainstream that all the subs doing these started becoming homogeneous, to the point where nothing had the edge or bite that I liked, it was all a bit too casual I guess you could say. That tends to happen with a lot of things when they go mainstream, they lose character.
